column1: '''Omentielva''' (also the International Conference on J.R.R. Tolkien’s Invented Languages) is a biennial scholarly conference for the invented languages of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. The name of the conference comes from the [[Quenya]] word for "meeting"
column2: ''[[omentie]]''. The meetings are all numbered using the appropriate Quenya ordinal. Thus
column3: the first meeting is called Omentielva Minya (literally "first meeting").

column1: The First International Conference on J.R.R. Tolkien’s Invented Languages was held from August 4 through August 8
The Second International Conference on J.R.R. Tolkien’s Invented Languages was held from August 8 through August 11
The Third International Conference on J.R.R. Tolkien’s Invented Languages was held from August 6 through August 9
The Fourth International Conference on J.R.R. Tolkien’s Invented Languages was held from August 11 through August 14
The Fifth International Conference on J.R.R. Tolkien’s Invented Languages was held from August 8 through August 11
The Sixth International Conference on J.R.R. Tolkien’s Invented Languages was held from August 6 through August 9
The Seventh International Conference on J.R.R. Tolkien’s Invented Languages was held from August 10 through August 13
column2: 2017 at California State University's Hayward Campus in the eastern San Francisco Bay area.<ref>[http://www.omentielva.com/next.htm California 2017]</ref>

column1: The Eighth International Conference on J.R.R. Tolkien's Invented Languages will be held in Reykjavik
column2: Iceland in 2019. For the time being unconformed date is August 8 through August 11.<ref>[https://www.facebook.com/events/124931141545118/ Reykjavik 2019]</ref>
